author: Europa Press
title: Marlaska ironiza con que a Feijóo se le hace "larga" la campaña y si durase una semana más "pediría el voto para PSOE"
text:
Asegura que el rezo del rosario el próximo sábado durante la jornada de reflexión frente a la sede del PSOE "no es convivencia"
 PONFERRADA (LEÓN), 6 Jun. (EUROPA PRESS) -
 El ministro del Interior, Fernando Grande-Marlaska ha afirmado este jueves que al líder de la oposición, Alberto Núñez Feijóo, se le hacen "largas" las campañas electorales y ha ironizado sobre que "si la campaña durase una semana más, el líder 'popular' acabaría pidiendo el voto para el PSOE".
 El ministro del Interior se ha incorporado a última hora al mitin que el Partido Socialista ha celebrado este jueves en la Fábrica de la Luz-Museo de la Energía de Ponferrada (León), en sustitución de su homólogo en la cartera de Política Territorial y Memoria Democrática, Ángel Víctor Torres que ha cancelado su presencia debido al fallecimiento de su padre.
 En la recta final de la campaña de las Europeas, Marlaska ha reivindicado la labor del Gobierno y ha destacado la subida del Salario Mínimo Interprofesional como "la medida que mejor representa los valores progresistas" de entre toda la acción de su gobierno.
 Grande-Marlaska también se ha referido a la polémica por la reciente citación a la mujer de Pedro Sánchez, Begoña Gómez, como investigada por un supuesto delito de corrupción y tráfico de influencias y ha acusado a PP y Vox de estar instalados en "el bulo" y en "el ataque personal" para "criminalizar a todos aquellos que no comparten sus valores".
 En el mitin también han participado el líder provincial del PSOE, Javier Alfonso-Cendón, el presidente del Consejo Comarcal del Bierzo, Olegario Ramón y la número 32 de la lista socialista al Parlamento Europeo, la ponferradina Claudia Alba.
 En su discurso, Marlaska ha salido al paso de la autorización del Tribunal Superior de Justicia de Madrid (TSJM) para el rezo del rosario el próximo sábado durante la jornada de reflexión frente a la sede nacional del PSOE y ha indicado que este tipo de acciones "no son convivencia".
 En este sentido, el ministro ha señalado a "derecha y extrema derecha" por "dinamitar la convivencia democrática" y se ha dirigido a Olegario Ramón, víctima de una agresión por parte de un manifestante hace unas semanas ante la sede del PSOE local, para apuntar que esa violencia "sale de estos discursos agresivos".
OFERTA DE EMPLEO Durante su intervención Marlaska ha anticipado "una Oferta de Empleo Público extraordinaria para Policía Nacional y Guardia Civil" que se anunciará la próxima semana.
 El titular de la cartera de Interior ha defendido su labor durante estos seis años al frente de su Ministerio y ha destacado que ahora los FCSE presentan "un número histórico de agentes".
Leer más acerca de: Feijóo PSOE Marlaska

author: Stuart Gentle Publisher
title: One in three UK businesses lack the skills to deliver their AI strategy, research finds | Onrec
text:
- New MHR report highlights how widespread confidence in AI’s potential to drive competitive advantage masks cultural and ethical challenges
- However, the opportunity remains significant for those with a clear adoption plan, with 64% of UK leaders seeing AI roll-out as a strategic priority
MHR, the specialist provider of HR, payroll and finance software, today published new research revealing a significant skills gap among UK businesses preparing to adopt artificial intelligence. Turning insight into impact: Empowering people with AI finds that, while 91% say they are ready to embrace the technology, one in three admit they lack the skills to implement it effectively.
The research, based on responses from over 1,000 UK business leaders, highlights a growing divide between AI ambition and readiness. Around two-thirds (64%) now see AI as a high strategic priority, but fewer than half (48%) feel fully prepared to deploy it in key areas of their business. Some of the barriers are familiar: legacy systems, fragmented processes, and human error. More than one in three respondents (35%) say human error in data entry is still an issue, pointing to a lack of clarity around how AI tools should be used, and 14% admit they don’t know where to start with AI at all.
However, where businesses get adoption right, the benefits can be substantial, individually and collectively. Effective use of AI and automation has the potential to save time, reduce errors, and boost productivity – not by replacing people, but empowering them to do their best work. The report also highlights where AI is already making a difference across UK organisations:
- 62% are using it for financial forecasting to inform financial planning and decision-making
- 60% to support day-to-day processes via co-pilots
- 58% to improve workflow automation
- 52% for content creation, including job descriptions and employee learning courses
“There is no shortage of AI ambition, and the opportunity for transformation is real,” said Anton Roe, CEO of MHR. “But without the right skills and employee engagement, strategies risk stalling at the start. The organisations winning with AI are those that start from the ground up - reskilling their people, involving them in shaping AI’s role within the business, and fostering a culture that embraces change responsibly and empathetically. Technology on its own won’t deliver the value; people and processes will.”
The research also reveals that skills gaps are only part of the picture. Cultural and ethical challenges are holding some organisations back. While AI is often positioned as a strategic lever, it’s not always being implemented inclusively. Just 38% of organisations involve employees in shaping AI use, while a minority say ethical guidelines are unnecessary. Ethical concerns now outpace financial ones: 35% cite ethics as a barrier to AI adoption, compared to 27% who point to budget constraints.
Despite significant investment, many businesses struggle to move beyond initial AI projects. AI is often introduced in a top-down manner, with limited input from those expected to use it daily. This leads to uneven adoption: some employees experiment independently, while others disengage due to unclear guidance or lack of trust. Without a clear, inclusive strategy, AI tools risk being underused, limiting their impact.
“Embedding AI successfully is really a change management challenge,” adds Roe. “It needs to enhance human skills, not bypass them, and that means bringing employees into the conversation early. Understanding where AI can support people in their roles, and managing adoption with care, is the only way to move beyond pilot mode and make AI stick.”

author: Xóchitl Álvarez
title: “Gracias a Dios acabó la campaña y sigo viva”: Xóchitl Gálvez | El Universal
text:
León, Gto.- Xóchitl Gálvez confesó en público que tras la derrota electoral del 2 de junio pasó una semana de tristeza en la que se refugió en su casa con sus hijos, en familia, pero pidió a los “Xóchitl-lovers” darle vuelta a la página para ponerse a trabajar, porque no pueden quedarse lamentando toda la vida. “No se queden con ese dolor, ¡hay que superarlo!”, dijo a sus seguidores. En la gira de agradecimiento por el estado de Guanajuato , la senadora manifestó su gratitud por las oraciones que ofrecieron por ella, porque “Gracias a Dios acabó la campaña y acabé viva”. Recordó que algunos candidatos con los que caminó fueron asesinados.
“Después de todo lo que yo viví de agresión, yo decía: ‘Lo único que quiero el 3 de junio es tener a mi familia completa’, porque te jugabas la vida; yo caminé con Alfredo (Cabrera) de Coyuca de Benítez (Guerrero), de la mano en el arranque de mi campaña, y mataron a Alfredo el día de su cierre de campaña”.
“¡Imagínense, caminé con el candidato a alcalde de Ciudad Mante, Tamaulipas (Noé Ramos, de la coalición PAN-PRI-PRD) y lo mataron!; o sea, uno aquí se estaba jugando la vida”.
Lee también “No somos iguales”, revira AMLO a Xóchitl Gálvez tras acusarlo de intervenir en el pasado proceso electoral
Xóchitl Gálvez dijo a los “Xóchitl-lovers” que no tiene mucha esperanza en la impugnación contra el resultado electoral del 2 de junio que presentó ante el Tribunal Electoral. Foto: Xóchitl Álvarez Xóchitl Gálvez dijo a los “Xóchitl-lovers” que no tiene mucha esperanza en la impugnación contra el resultado electoral del 2 de junio que presentó ante el Tribunal Electoral, en donde presentaron las pruebas de la intervención del presidente, y sostuvo que fue una elección de Estado. “Honestamente sí, el tribunal no hizo nada durante la elección, yo no le veo ganas de poder hacer nada”.
Entonces, dijo que no pueden quedarse lamentando por siempre, y ponerse a trabajar en la generación de conciencia de los derechos. “Cuando llegue tu trabajador y les digas: ‘¿cómo te fue en el Seguro?’, ‘Pues no me dieron las medicinas’, ‘¿Sabes qué?, es tu derecho a tener medicinas’”.
La ex candidata opositora también comentó a sus simpatizantes que fueron 19 millones de votos la diferencia entre ella y Claudia Sheinbaum , “ni modo, ni modo, no nos alcanzó”. Dijo que en esta democracia se debe aprender a perder.
“Tenemos que aprender a perder, aunque nos duela que nos hicieron trampa, que nos metieron el pie, que el árbitro se portó mal”, pero comentó que por la cantidad de votos el resultado es irreversible.
Xóchitl Gálvez envía a AMLO manual y libro sobre violencia política de género; "al Presidente no se le está sancionando"

author: @cairo24_
title: إصابة مراقب و4 طلاب بحالات مرضية مفاجئة خلال امتحانات الثانوية العامة بالمنيا
text:
إصابة مراقب و4 طلاب بحالات مرضية مفاجئة خلال امتحانات الثانوية العامة بالمنيا
الخميس 26/يونيو/2025 - 11:40 ص
أُصيب مراقب و4 طلاب بحالات مرضية مفاجئة، اليوم الخميس، أثناء تأدية امتحانات الثانوية العامة في عدد من لجان محافظة المنيا، تزامنًا مع امتحاني الفيزياء والتاريخ.
إصابة مراقب و4 طلاب خلال امتحانات الثانوية العامة في المنيا
وتنوعت الإصابات بين مغص كلوي ومعوي وهبوط عام، وتم نقل المصابين إلى مستشفيات متخصصة في إدارات المنيا وملوي وبني مزار وديرمواس لتلقي الرعاية اللازمة، فيما تم تصنيف جميع البلاغات كـ "حالات مرضية طارئة".
وتواصل غرفة عمليات التربية والتعليم متابعة الموقف بالتنسيق مع مديرية الصحة، لضمان استقرار اللجان وسلامة جميع الطلاب.

author: 吳漢培
title: 俄烏戰爭｜澤連斯基控俄圖擾亂東南歐 普京強調俄擁核三位一體
text:
烏克蘭總統澤連斯基（Volodymyr Zelenskiy）指控，俄羅斯意圖在烏克蘭南部及歐洲東南部地區製造混亂及造成擾亂，呼籲向俄施壓避免未來軍事威脅。俄國總統普京（Vladimir Putin）強調，俄軍擁有「三位一體」核打擊力量。
俄烏戰爭｜俄烏交換首批戰俘 澤連斯基分數階段換俘 【下一頁】
澤連斯基周三（11日）在南部港口城市敖德薩（Odesa）舉行的會議中，呼籲歐洲東南部國家領袖需要集體團結行動，避免俄羅斯嘗試擾亂區域安全。他指東南歐及黑海安全密不可分，烏克蘭現時的戰爭不止為自身，亦是為新區域政策基石而戰。
澤連斯基指俄羅斯希望摧毀舉行會議的敖德薩，俄軍的計劃將針對歐洲東南部，劍指摩爾多瓦及羅馬尼亞在內邊境地區。他直指相關國家需要有所保障，需要長期安全保障防範俄軍在歐洲東南部造成混亂。
同時，澤連斯基亦表示，俄羅斯過去30年嘗試讓摩爾多瓦維持貧困及不穩定，尋求達成全面控制目的。他指如果歐洲2025年失去摩爾多瓦，將刺激俄國對其他歐洲國家作更大膽擾亂行動，呼籲應加強施壓俄羅斯避免未來軍事威脅。
俄烏戰爭｜普京誓報復烏「蜘蛛網行動」 特朗普認與普京對話未立即促成和平 【下一頁】
摩爾多瓦的親歐盟總統桑杜（Maia Sandu）曾指控俄羅斯，嘗試在當地製造混亂及推翻其總統職位。摩爾多瓦將在9月舉行大選，結果將影響該國推進尋求2030年加入歐盟的計劃。
普京同日在電視播放與俄羅斯武器工業官員會議時表示，俄羅斯全新武器計劃中，應特別關注俄軍的核三位一體打擊能力，即從海陸空發射核子武器。他表明核三位一體打擊能力仍是俄國主權的保障，亦是維持全球力量平衡的關鍵角色。
普京亦指出，俄軍多達95%的戰略核武力量達最新標準，強調俄軍為全球擁核國家中核武現代化比例最高。
緊貼地緣政治變化，立即免費下載《香港經濟日報》App【 按此 】

author: Mauricio Venegas
title: Academy Update: March 2024 Players of the Month | Inter Miami CF
text: With the third month of the year already in the rearview mirror for the Inter Miami CF Academy presented by Baptist Health, let's unveil the players that earned Player of the Month honors for March. For our Academy's youngest age groups, it's U-12 player Yohan Calixte who gets the nod as Player of the Month. "Yohan has shown a high level of performance throughout all trainings and games. He is a player with great responsibility both defensively and offensively. His behavior on and off the field has been exemplary, always showing values of respect, commitment, companionship and personal effort," said U-12 Academy team head coach Diego Garcia. "I believe his individual and collective technique, interpretation of the game in all its phases and over everything his quality of being a team player, are characteristics to highlight." Moving onto our Academy's mid-level age brackets, U-14/U-15 player Kai Nesfield earns Player of the Month honors for March. "Kai had the honor to be called up for the USYNT camp in Atlanta this month along with the top players born in 2010 in the country. He also is currently in Croatia for another national camp with the Croatian national team. Kai has shown incredible commitment on and off the field, performing well playing a year up with the U-15 team, as well as being a top performer when playing with the U-14s. He is a dedicated young man that is always opened to learning and developing," expressed U-15 team head coach Pedro Cavalcanti. Lastly, U-17/U-19 attacker Daniel Pinter is named Player of the Month for our Academy's eldest teams. "Daniel's performances for our U-17 and U-19 teams earned him the opportunity to make his professional debut with Inter Miami II against the New York Red Bulls on March 24. We are proud to have seen him make his debut and have an impact on the game by scoring a late equalizer for the team," highlighted U-19 team head coach Giuseppe DePalo. For additional coverage of our teams, you can follow our Academy’s journey online via X [@InterMiamiAcad](https://twitter.com/intermiamiacad?s=21) and Instagram [@InterMiamiCFAcademy](https://www.instagram.com/intermiamicf_academy/?hl=en)!

author: Syndicated Content
title: Nicaragua arrests two high-ranking Catholic priests with close ties to cardinal
text:
By Ismael Lopez
SAN JOSE (Reuters) – Nicaraguan police detained on Thursday two senior Catholic priests who are close to the country’s top church leader, a person with knowledge of the matter said, raising to at least six the number of clergymen detained this week.
The source, who declined to be named for fear of arrest, said the two priests were detained for publicly praying for jailed Bishop Rolando Alvarez, the most prominent critic of President Daniel Ortega.
Local media outlet Confidencial named the priests as Carlos Aviles and Hector Treminio, and noted that their arrest brings to at least six the number of priests detained over the past week, adding that two of the clerics had already been released.
The government’s press office did not immediately respond to a request for comment.
Over the past few years, Ortega’s government has targeted members of the Catholic church, a crackdown officials have in the past said was needed to punish treasonous behavior or other alleged crimes.
Aviles is the second-highest ranking cleric in the Archdiocese of Managua, led by Cardinal Leopoldo Brenes, while Treminio is its treasurer.
Alvarez, the bishop of Matagalpa, forcefully criticized the government’s deadly response to mass protests that broke out in 2018, and was convicted of treason and sentenced to a 26-year prison term earlier this year.
Last week, police arrested Bishop Isidro Mora of the Siuna diocese, making him the second bishop to be detained after Alvarez’s detention in 2022.
Many of the latest clergymen detained were arrested because they publicly offered prayers for Alvarez, according to the source and local media, but the government has not issued any statements explaining the priests’ alleged crimes.
Nicaraguan Bishop Silvio Baez, who has been living in exile in Florida since 2019 and is the second-ranking leader of the archdiocese, called for the priests to be released.
“I ask God to protect them and that they be freed immediately!” wrote in a post on X on Thursday.
According to exiled Nicaraguan researcher Martha Patricia Molina, who publishes records of what she describes as the persecution of the Catholic Church under Ortega, the number of bishops, priests and seminarians behind bars in the country currently stands at nine.
(Reporting by Ismael Lopez; Writing by David Alire Garcia and Miral Fahmy)
